TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit SqlProcedureAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Used to mark a method definition in an assembly as a stored procedure. The properties on the attribute reflect the physical characteristics used when the type is registered with SQL Server. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks SqlProcedureAttribute is used only by Microsoft Visual Studio to automatically register the specified method as a stored procedure. It is not used by SQL Server.
See "CLR Stored Procedures" in SQL Server 2005 Books Online for more information on CLR stored procedures and examples.
## Examples The following example shows a method declaration in an assembly that has been attributed as a stored procedure. The SqlProcedureAttribute property has been set to the name of the stored procedure.
[!code-vb[DataWorks SqlProcedureAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-microsoft.sqlserver.se_9_1.vb)] [!code-cs[DataWorks SqlProcedureAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-microsoft.sqlserver.se_9_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: An attribute on a method definition in an assembly, used to indicate that the given method should be registered as a stored procedure in SQL Server.
The name of the stored procedure.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> representing the name of the stored procedure.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The property is optional.
The following example specifies that the stored procedure is referenced using the name `sp_sqlName`.
## Examples [!code-cs[VbRaddataSQLObjects#7](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/CS/InsertCurrency.cs#7)] [!code-vb[VbRaddataSQLObjects#7](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/VB/InsertCurrency.vb#7)]
